message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about evaluating open-domain dialogue systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The use of distributed sentence representations and entailment techniques suggests a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) methods. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the development of metrics for evaluating dialogue systems, which could fall under cs.LG (Learning) or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the use of information retrieval (IR) techniques for approximating human judgment also suggests cs.IR as a possible sub-category.
